meanings.definition: The place where someone or something is located or has been put.
meanings.sent1: She carefully checked the positions of the toys on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The positions of the chairs in the room made it feel cozy.
meanings.sent3: The positions of the cookies in the jar seemed to change every time she looked.
meanings.sent4: His positions on the soccer field were like pieces on a chessboard, strategic and precise.
meanings.sent5: The positions of the stars in the sky guided sailors on their journey.

meanings.definition: A particular way in which someone or something is placed or arranged.
meanings.sent1: The gymnast's positions during her routine were graceful and elegant.
meanings.sent2: The positions of the books on the shelf made it easy to find the one she wanted.
meanings.sent3: The positions of the vegetables in the salad seemed to dance as she tossed them together.
meanings.sent4: Her positions on the debate team were strong and well-supported.
meanings.sent5: The positions of the chess pieces on the board determined the outcome of the game.

meanings.definition: A job or role in an organization or society.
meanings.sent1: He applied for multiple positions at the company to increase his chances of getting hired.
meanings.sent2: The positions of president and vice president were up for election.
meanings.sent3: The positions of the clowns in the circus made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her positions in the community allowed her to make positive changes.
meanings.sent5: The positions of the actors on stage brought the play to life.
